intro: Pedicularis lanata var. dasyantha, commonly known as the woolly monkeyflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils. Pedicularis lanata var. dasyantha is a member of the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species.
